title: [Self-Directed] Functional Relationship Exploration Based on 3D Modeling of Biochemical Molecular Structures

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational biochemistry theory and understanding of molecular biology concepts
context.additional_context: Blended learning environment emphasizing hands-on practice with smartphones and simple 3D-printed models, highlighting case-based activities reflecting in-service practitionersâ€™ characteristics

learning_goals: Learners can manipulate 3D-printed DNA/RNA models to explain the functional roles of the double-helix structure and sugar-phosphate backbone.
Learners can analyze the specificity of protein-DNA interactions from a structural perspective using transcription factor-binding models.
Learners can predict the impact of DNA supercoiling on gene expression through simulations utilizing 3D models.

resources: 3D-Printed Molecular Model Kit (for DNA/RNA, Transcription Factors, Supercoiling Simulation)
Model-Specific Instruction Cards and Activity Guides
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
